alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 3:19PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 318 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Goose Creek, Hanahan, West Ashley, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Johns Island, Downtown Charleston, Daniel Island, Hollywood, Ravenel, Meggett, Magnolia Gardens, Charleston Airport, Charles Towne Landing, Don Holt Bridge, Charleston Naval Complex, Shadowmoss, Red Top, Citadel Mall and Oakland.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
